title: Farm Machine Safety: Loader and Skid Steer Safety

tasks.task: Operating Farm and Skid Steer Loaders Safely
subtasks: Understand the causes of tractor rollovers
Use ROPS to prevent serious accidents
Follow load limit guidelines in operator's manuals
Check tire spacing and rear ballast before use
Wear seat belt when operating tractors or loaders
Manage bucket height to prevent rollovers
Consider center of gravity changes with different loads
Drive loaders slowly when raising or lowering loads
Be cautious when handling loads around people
Secure loads properly before moving them
Adjust driving technique when turning on slopes
Carry loads low on public roads for stability
Use appropriate signage when operating on public roads
Properly handle large round bales with specialized attachments
Keep bales secure during transport
Take necessary precautions during loader servicing
Avoid pinch points and rotating parts when servicing loaders
Check for hydraulic leaks using a reliable method

tasks.task: Navigating Public Roadways Safely with Loaders
subtasks: Lower loader and shut off engine before servicing
Be aware of pinch points during servicing
Proper hydraulic maintenance techniques
Check for leaks using an effective method
Secure bales with restraints when using regular loaders
Keep bales as low as possible during transport
Engage parking brake or set transmission to park before service
Lower loader to ground before removing keys or disconnecting
Check tire spacing and rear ballast prior to use

tasks.task: So in total, I think the main tasks are about general safety practices (including ROPS usage and load limits), operating the loader (including load handling and slopes), navigating public roads (with load height and signage), and maintaining the equipment safely (checking for leaks, servicing with care). Each of these main topics could be a MAINTASK with their own subtasks.
**MAINTASK: Operating Farm and Skid Steer Loaders Safely**
